thread.title: SCISA swimming championships set for Saturday, SCHSL event postponed
thread.title_full: SCISA swimming championships set for Saturday, SCHSL event postponed

title: SCISA swimming championships set for Saturday, SCHSL event postponed
text:
SCISA swimming championships set for Saturday, SCHSL event postponed 
BY DAVID SHELTON 
Special to The Post and Courier Oct 7 2015 6:21 pm The SCISA swimming state championships will be held at the Augusta Aquatics Center on Saturday. File/Aiken Standard × State championships in swimming for the South Carolina Independent Schools Association (SCISA) will take place on Saturday at the Augusta Aquatic Center in Augusta, Ga. The S.C. High School League championships, also scheduled for Saturday at the USC Natatorium in Columbia, have been moved to next weekend because of flooding in the midlands. The First Baptist girls’ team will be seeking a ninth consecutive SCISA AAA state championship but will face a major challenge from local rival Porter-Gaud. The two teams were separated by only 24 points in last year’s finals. First Baptist senior Logan Kraft, who won two individual gold medals last year, is back as the leader of this year’s team. Logan’s sister, freshman Kelsey Kraft, and Grace Arrendondo are state title contenders as well. Anchoring Porter-Gaud’s effort are Elysse Pardus and Jessica Weitz – both double gold medal winners last season. The First Baptist boys won their first-ever team title last season and are again one of the top contenders. The Hurricanes’ top returning performer is Ethan Madden. Porter-Gaud and Pinewood Prep also will contend. Pinewood Prep finished as state runner-up last season. Junior Shrine Bowl to be played The Shrine Bowl of the Carolinas announced this week that the inaugural Junior Shrine Bowl all-star game will be played on Dec. 19 at 10 a.m. at Wofford College’s Gibbs Stadium. The event will serve as a prelude to the 79th annual Shrine Bowl game for senior players from North and South Carolina. The junior game will include the state’s top junior players from the two states and those rosters will be announced on Nov. 5. Among the top local candidates for the junior game include Wando receiver Ortre Smith, Summerville receiver Cam Burnette, Berkeley quarterback Darius Douglas, Fort Dorchester defensive end DeAndre Peterson and James Island receiver Jordan McDaniel. Volleyball, tennis playoffs The state playoffs in volleyball and girls’ tennis will begin in less than two weeks with several area teams expected to be major contenders. The SCISA state playoffs in volleyball begin in Sumter on Oct. 21 with the finals set for Oct. 26-27. Porter-Gaud is seeking a sixth consecutive championship in AAA and rival Ashley Hall could end up in the finals as well. The SCHSL volleyball playoffs begin Oct. 21-22. Bishop England is contending for a 16th consecutive state title in Class AA while Wando is the defending AAAA state champion. The girls’ tennis state tournament begins Oct. 22. Bishop England is the defending class AA state champion while Wando was the AAAA state runner-up last year. Keywords
